Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Rev. Sully Guillaume-Same, St. Thomas Episcopal Church, located at 1405 Bushwick Avenue, Brooklyn NY 11207.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Nurse.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rev. Sully Guillaume-Same, St. Thomas Episcopal Church located at 1405 Bushwick Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11207.

Council Member Nurse moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of April 11, 2024 and April 18, 2024 be adopted as printed by Council Member Krishnan.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Krishnan moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meetings of April 11, 2024 and April 18, 2024, 2024 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting certificate setting forth the maximum amount of debt and reserves which the City, and the NYC Municipal Water Finance Authority and the New York City Transitional Finance Authority may soundly incur for capital projects for Fiscal Year 2025 and the ensuing three fiscal years, and the maximum amount of appropriations and expenditures for capital projects which may soundly be made during each fiscal year.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Submitting Certificate setting forth the maximum amount of debt and reserves which the City, and the NYC Municipal Water Finance Authority, may soundly incur for capital projects for FY'25 and the ensuing 3 fiscal years.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the Expense Revenue Contract Budget, for Fiscal Year 2025, pursuant to Section 249 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Submitting the Expense Revenue Contract Budget, for Fiscal Year 2025.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the Executive Capital Budget for Fiscal Year 2025, pursuant to Section 249 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Submitting the Executive Capital Budget for Fiscal Year 2025.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the Executive Budget Supporting Schedules, for Fiscal Year 2025 pursuant to Section 250 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Submitting the Executive Budget Supporting Schedules, for Fiscal Year 2025.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the Capital Commitment Plan, Executive Budget, Fiscal Year 2025, Volumes 1, 2, 3 and 4, pursuant to Section 219(d) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Submitting the Capital Commitment Plan, Executive Budget, Fiscal Year 2025, Volumes 1, 2, 3 and 4.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the Budget Summary, the Message of the Mayor, and the Program to Eliminate the Gap relative to the Executive Budget, Fiscal Year 2025, pursuant to Section 249 of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Submitting the Budget Summary, the Message of the Mayor, and the Program to Eliminate the Gap relative to the Executive Budget, Fiscal Year 2025.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the Proposed City Fiscal Year 2025 Community Development Program, the Proposed CFY'25 Budget, the Proposed Allocation of Calendar Year 2024/CD 50 Funds, the Proposed Calendar Year 2025/CD 51 Budget, dated April 25, 2024.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Submitting the Proposed City Fiscal Year 2025 Community Development Program.

Introduction & Reading of Bills

Resolutions

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring third-party food delivery services and third-party courier services to provide food delivery workers with information underlying their pay calculations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection
Items.MatterName: Requiring third-party food delivery services and third-party courier services to provide food delivery workers with information underlying their pay calculations

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring disclosure of community benefit agreements in the annual report by certain contracted entities.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: Requiring disclosure of community benefit agreements in the annual report by certain contracted entities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring certain contracted entities to make public job training and employment data collected pursuant to projects in excess of $150,000.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: Requiring certain contracted entities to make public job training and employment data collected pursuant to projects in excess of $150,000.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to staff each police precinct with a licensed social worker
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to staff each police precinct with a licensed social worker.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to expanding the application of procurement procedures for certain service contracts, and enhancing public notice requirements for changes to planned contract actions
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Expanding the application of procurement procedures for certain service contracts, and enhancing public notice requirements for changes to planned contract actions

Items.Title: Resolution calling on Mayor Eric Adams to appoint Family Court judges to fill all judicial vacancies and to promptly fill all future vacancies that arise.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Children and Youth
Items.MatterName: Mayor Eric Adams to appoint Family Court judges to fill all judicial vacancies and to promptly fill all future vacancies that arise.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.8502/A.9509, in relation to establishing a New York City grant program for laundry equipment or facilities in certain schools.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Establishing a New York City grant program for laundry equipment or facilities in certain schools (S.8502/A.9509).

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a study and report on the expansion of ferry service along the Rockaway Peninsula
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
Items.MatterName: Study and report on the expansion of ferry service along the Rockaway Peninsula.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to records of the chief medical examiner that relate to work-related fatal injuries in the workplace, and to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on workplace fatalities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection
Items.MatterName: Records of the chief medical examiner that relate to work-related fatal injuries in the workplace, and to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on workplace fatalities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to enforcing the human rights law and conducting an information campaign for places of public accommodation
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.MatterName: Enforcing the human rights law and conducting an information campaign for places of public accommodation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the sale of menstrual and intimate care products that contain unsafe ingredients
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the sale of menstrual and intimate care products that contain unsafe ingredients.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the distribution of hypodermic syringes and needles by mobile syringe service programs within 450 feet of schools and playgrounds.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the distribution of hypodermic syringes and needles by mobile syringe service programs within 450 feet of schools and playgrounds

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a public campaign on parental mental health resources
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
Items.MatterName: Public campaign on parental mental health resources.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to an annual report on compliance with the Americans with disabilities act standards for accessible design by the department of parks and recreation, and to repeal and replace section 18-143 of the administrative code of the city of New York
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
Items.MatterName: Annual report on compliance with the Americans with disabilities act standards for accessible design by the department of parks and recreation, and to repeal and replace section 18-143 of the administrative code of the city of New York.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.319/A.5625, which mandates all medical students in New York State to receive anti-bias training.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Mandates all medical students in New York State to receive anti-bias training (S.319/A.5625).

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the New York City Police Department to report on arrests of individuals under eighteen years of age.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation mandating Medicaid Managed Care Organizations to collect and report prenatal and postpartum depression screenings and follow-up data using HEDIS measures.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
Items.MatterName: Mandating Medicaid Managed Care Organizations to collect and report prenatal and postpartum depression screenings and follow-up data using HEDIS measures.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation to require health insurance plans to develop and implement a maternal mental health quality management program to promote access to affordable and comprehensive maternal mental health services.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
Items.MatterName: Require health insurance plans to develop and implement a maternal mental health quality management program to promote access to affordable and comprehensive maternal mental health services

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation mandating all accredited psychiatry residency programs to offer a one-year, post-residency fellowship program specifically focused on Perinatal Mental Health (PMH).
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
Items.MatterName: Mandating all accredited psychiatry residency programs to offer a one-year, post-residency fellowship program specifically focused on Perinatal Mental Health.

Items.MatterName: Designating May annually as Maternal Mental Health Awareness Month in the City of New York. (S.156/A.6603)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, the New York Child Data Privacy and Protection Act (S.3281/A.4967) and the Stop Addictive Feeds Exploitation (SAFE) for Kids Act (S.7694/A.8148).
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: New York Child Data Privacy and Protection Act  and the Stop Addictive Feeds Exploitation (SAFE) for Kids Act (S.3281/A.4967)(S.7694/A.8148).

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Farías) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías).

There were 48 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, May 23,  2024.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
